title.narrative: 3.3 Communication for Development (C4D) & BEHAVIOURAL CHANGE

description.narrative: Parents and other duty bearers understand the importance of early learning opportunities and continued education, and support their children, especially girls, to enroll, attend and succeed in their education., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, Pakistan's most disadvantaged children, especially girls and minority groups, are participating in structured early learning and completing ten years of quality education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Parents and other duty bearers understand the importance of early learning opportunities and continued education, and support theirchildren, especially girls, to enroll, attend and succeed in their education.

description.narrative: Social and community mobilisation and enrolment campaigns contributed to the enrolment of more than 772,000 children (41 per cent girls); approximately 51,000 children and youth (48 per cent girls) in government schools and ALP centres participated in co-curricular activities. Also 1,677 SMCS/PTSMCs/TIJs and 42 local education councils were capacitated. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2018
